newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium fixes terms for May 26 state note issue.
newsitem.headline: Belgium fixes terms for May 26 state note issue.

text.p: The Belgian Finance Ministry announced on Friday the terms it will apply to its next issue of state notes targeted at retail investors.
The issue is due to run from May 26 to June 3.
In a statement the finance ministry said it would offer:

A five-year note, extendable to seven years, with a fixed, 4.70 percent coupon and a revisable note, with put options at three, five and seven years, with an initial guaranteed minimum 3.85 percent coupon. The guaranteed minimum coupons at five years and seven years would rise to 4.70 percent and 5.35 percent.
Both issues would be sold a par.
